item.title: How can i make a JButton open up an internet page?
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

In what? The user’s default browser? A JEditorPane?

Well, either way, you have to add an ActionListener to the JButton. In the actionPerformed method, you can open the browser/display website in a JEditorPane.
Have a look at javax.swing.JEditorPane.
Alternately, you can be naughty and use Runtime.exec()

String url = "http://www.IamCool.com"; Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler " + url);
But you’ll get your head bitten off for that, since it will only work in windows.
Actually, I’ve never tried it in my life, so don’t hold me to that.

Read full topic
item.source: How can i make a JButton open up an internet page?
